title: Open data literacy in the classroom

details.description:
Data literacy is a basic skill we will expect of employees and citizens emerging out of Generation Open, just like being able to read, write and do simple maths.

In this session we look at some ways schools can introduce and incorporate open data across a range of curriculum subject areas to develop this new literacy without compromising their curriculum goals.

<< Back to full schedule

Suitable for

Non-specialists with a role or interest in education. This may include parents, school governors, NGO workers, teachers and curriculum leads.

About the trainer: Jag Goraya

Jag Goraya delivers open data engagement and literacy programmes for citizens, policymakers and schools. He is a governor of UTC Sheffield, leading on its specialist data-driven Applied Computing curriculum, and has a long history of nurturing peer learning practitioner communities and developing user-driven products and services through lean, agile and open innovation methods.
